title: Opentype font that isn't part of any language...
content:
I am making a font for a chinese music instrument’s tablature. It’s a CJK ideograph based font. First of all, there are glyph that are out of the unicode prescribed glyph, but I have to code them in some fashion. Therefore, many of those glyph is in the private use range. Second, it seems like the script named does not support features like and so on. But i desperately need that. Third, I dont know what script am I suppose to use when the font falls mainly into the private use range. So, is there a way to code at least half of my glyph (which has a total of 1800) and still able to use feature like ? Thanks in advance. A sample of what is happening is attached, but all coded in the CJK range NOT the private use range YET.

I have posted in VOLT MSNgroup but no one reply. Thankx in advance.
author: agraveman

comments.content:
\> Therefore, many of those glyph is in the private use range. Second, it seems like the script named does not support features like and so on. But i desperately need that.

What OpenType features are you looking to use? Please explain.
In what applications are you hoping to use the font? This has a bearing since different text engines approach script identification in different ways.

mkmk, mark, calt and ccmp is all I needed for now. calt is a large part of the font. I would like to use it in wordpad and other uniscribe-able application in Windows environment. P.S. I am sorry that I didn’t know I can’t put anything inside “
